comment.author: 25682088@N04
comment._content: love the drape of her dress along with the drape of the lampshade!

comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content:
Modern lamps are more attractive. 
As for the dress, it is unlikely that it was made in a factory.  Most of the cloths were made at home, or bought from a dressmaker, who made them in her home.  When I was young, and a starving teacher, my wife made everything our girls wore and a lot of what the boys wore.  She also made her own clothes and sometimes even something like a shirt  for me.

comment.author: 22575440@N07
comment._content: maybe it's just me, but she looks a little bit like Brenda Fricker in the face, no?
